VELLAISAMY, P

mixed orthogonal arrays
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Kronecker sum of binary orthogonal arrays have been introduced. It is well known that for any t >= 2, OA(2(t) t + 1, 2, t) exists. We give conditions under which OA(2(t), t+ 1, 2, t) is self-conjugate, and show the existence of mixed OA(2(t), n x 2(t+1), 2). Also, we prove that the existence of OA(N, k, 2, t'), t' >= 2, implies the existence of OA(N2(t), k(t + 1), 2, p), which is a-resolvable, and obtain mixed OA(N2(t), n x 2(4k(t+1)), p) therefrom, where p = 2 if max(t, t') = 2, and p = 3 if max(t, t') >= 3, where t corresponds to the trivial OA(2(t), t + 1, 2, t).
